name: Thomas Mason
bio:
Parents: Records identify his father as John Mason (born approx. 1700) and his mother as Dorothy Sanders. Some sources also suggest a lineage back to Roger Mason Sr. and Mary "Molly" Andrews, though the Hanover County origins are more frequently cited in this family branch.

Family tradition often links this Mason branch to the prominent George Mason family of Virginia (the author of the Virginia Declaration of Rights), suggesting Thomas may have been a distant cousin. However, researchers typically distinguish this specific "Roanoke River" Mason line as a separate, though likely related, colonial branch.

His son, Peter Mason, was born in this same region of North Carolina in 1761 before the family eventually migrated further south to Georgia and Alabama.
